New Records: Trae Young hit a buzzer-beating 3-pointer from beyond the half-court line
Key Match Events: Trae Young's heave at the buzzer snapped the Hawks' skid and was the team's fifth in its last eight games.
Young finished with 24 points and 20 assists.
Dyson Daniels added 16 points, seven assists, and six rebounds for the Hawks, who snapped a three-game skid.
Lauri Markkanen made a season-high eight 3-pointers and scored a season-best 35 points for Utah.
Utah scored on five straight possessions and took a 114-113 lead on back-to-back dunks from Walker Kessler.
Pre-Game Insights: Utah fell behind by 14 points in the first quarter and 16 in the second before battling back both times and making it a one-possession game by halftime.
Post-Match Reflections: Young's heave at the buzzer snapped the Hawks' skid and was the team's fifth in its last eight games.
Utah has won just twice in 15 home games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Atlanta used a balanced attack with seven players scoring in double figures.
The Hawks finish a six-game road swing at Phoenix on Thursday. The Jazz host Miami on Thursday.
